title: Australia v England: Ashes second Test, day three – live
summary: The host team established a commanding 177-run lead in their first innings at the Gabba. They proceeded to bowl under lights, aiming to capitalize on their advantage. Live updates are available from our writers covering the match.

title: World Cup draw reaction, Q&A and fixture schedule to come – matchday live
summary: Catch all the latest insights and reactions from our writers regarding the World Cup draw. Stay updated with pre-match news and analysis as the tournament approaches. Don't miss expert opinions and key developments in the lead-up to the games.

title: Gunmen kill at least 11 people including three-year-old in South African hostel
summary: In a devastating early morning attack in Pretoria, 25 individuals were shot, including a 12-year-old boy and a 16-year-old girl among the victims. The incident has raised concerns about gun violence in the area. Authorities are investigating the shooting and its motives.

title: London councils have a ‘sustained reliance’ on private firms as report shows £500m spend
summary: New research reveals a growing dependency of authorities on private companies to perform essential public functions. This reliance raises concerns about accountability and efficacy in service delivery. Experts warn that such a trend could compromise public interests and oversight.

title: Ministers urged to close £2bn tax loophole in car finance scandal
summary: Banks and specialist lenders are exempt from paying taxes on compensation payouts, allowing them to avoid a rule established in 2015. This decision enables these financial institutions to retain more funds for other purposes. The move has raised discussions about its implications for taxation and accountability in the banking sector.
